intro: Cosmos schaffneri, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant produces small, spiny fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Cosmos schaffneri thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its rapid growth and vibrant blooms make it a notable ornamental plant.
